title: Assistant, Parrot, or Colonizing Loudspeaker? ChatGPT Metaphors for Developing Critical AI Literacies. (arXiv:2401.08711v1 [cs.HC])
abstract: This study explores how discussing metaphors for AI can help build awareness of the frames that shape our understanding of AI systems, particularly large language models (LLMs) like ChatGPT. Given the pressing need to teach "critical AI literacy", discussion of metaphor provides an opportunity for inquiry and dialogue with space for nuance, playfulness, and critique. Using a collaborative autoethnographic methodology, we analyzed metaphors from a range of sources, and reflected on them individually according to seven questions, then met and discussed our interpretations. We then analyzed how our reflections contributed to the three kinds of literacies delineated in Selber's multiliteracies framework: functional, critical, and rhetorical. These allowed us to analyze questions of ethics, equity, and accessibility in relation to AI. translated_title: 助手、鹦鹉还是殖民式喇叭？ChatGPT隐喻对培养AI批判素养的作用研究
translated_abstract: 本研究探讨了讨论AI隐喻如何帮助我们认识到影响我们对AI系统及其特别是大型语言模型（LLM）如ChatGPT的理解的框架，特别是在迫切需要教授“批判性AI素养”的情况下，隐喻的讨论提供了一个探究和对话的机会，为细微之处、趣味性和批评提供了空间。通过协作的自体民族志方法，我们分析了来自各种来源的隐喻，并根据七个问题对其进行了个别反思，然后进行了相互会议和讨论我们的解释。然后，我们分析了我们的反思如何有助于Selber的多元素素养框架中所描述的三种素养：功能性、批判性和修辞性。这些分析帮助我们探究了伦理、公平和可访问性与AI之间的关系。我们还评估了每个隐喻是否促进拟人化，以及这种隐喻在多大程度上暗示了AI的有感知能力。
tldr: 这项研究探讨了讨论AI隐喻如何帮助培养对AI系统和大型语言模型的理解，以及如何促进批判性AI素养的发展。通过分析隐喻并与其他人讨论，研究团队发现隐喻有助于对AI的伦理、公平和可访问性等问题进行思考，并评估了隐喻在是否促进拟人化方面的作用。
en_tdlr: This study explores how discussing metaphors for AI can help develop understanding of AI systems and promote the development of critical AI literacy. Through analyzing metaphors and engaging in discussions, the research team found that metaphors facilitate reflection on ethical, equity, and accessibility issues related to AI, as well as evaluating the extent to which metaphors promote anthropomorphism.
